pButton.Name: A
pButton.popInfo: Napoleon Bonaparte is in a classical pose associated with Roman emperors, the god Jupiter, and various kings and popes throughout the ages. He sits on a high backed throne that has elements of classical architecture.

pButton.Name: B
pButton.popInfo: Instead of a crown, on his head is a golden laurel-wreath, another reference to Roman gods and emperors. Napoleon had crowned himself emperor in 1804.

pButton.Name: C
pButton.popInfo: Even though Napoleon’s family was of Tuscan nobility, his father was a lawyer. In this coronation portrait, Napoleon wears the same velvet robes he wore for his coronation. He also wears an ermine hood, a fur reserved for royalty. Like French kings of the past, Napoleon wears the star of the Legion of Honor. The golden bees that decorate his cloak symbolize a new Golden Age.

pButton.Name: D
pButton.popInfo: The scepter he holds in his right hand is the same one held by Charlemagne, the first French king. In his left hand he holds a staff with a hand at the end that symbolizes justice. He also has a sword resting against his left knee.

pButton.Name: E
pButton.popInfo: Napoleon rests his feet on a cushion. The carpet under the throne displays an imperial eagle
